intro: Macadamia youngiana, commonly known as the silver nut. This evergreen shrub or small tree is native to Australia and belongs to the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its lance-shaped, silver-gray leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by hard, woody pods containing edible nuts. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, acidic soils.
